alert.note: Alert for Henderson; Henry; Mercer; Rock Island; Warren (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 07 at 6:56PM CDT until May 07 at 7:15PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 715 PM CDT FOR NORTHEASTERN HENDERSON...NORTHERN WARREN...ROCK ISLAND... MERCER...SOUTHWESTERN HENRY...SOUTHEASTERN LOUISA...SOUTHWESTERN SCOTT AND EAST CENTRAL MUSCATINE COUNTIES... At 656 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Osco to Griffin to near Seaton, moving southeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. These severe storms will be near... Cambridge, New Windsor, Andover, New Windsor, Osco, Henry County Fairgrounds and Morristown around 700 PM CDT. Alpha, Lynn Center, Ophiem and Ulah around 705 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Woodhull, Alexis, Gerlaw, North Henderson, Nekoma and Bishop Hill. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: Wind damage with these storms will occur before any rain or lightning. Do not wait for the sound of thunder before taking cover. SEEK SHELTER IMMEDIATELY inside a sturdy structure and stay away from windows.

area.areaDesc: Henderson; Henry; Mercer; Rock Island; Warren
